intro: Hieracium victoriae, commonly known as the Victoria's hawkweed, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 centimeters, featuring upright stems covered in fine, hairy foliage. Its flowers are yellow, with ray florets that are often shorter than the central disk florets. Hieracium victoriae is often found in alpine meadows and rocky habitats, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
